snippet: Yefim Ulitskiy, 55, has relied on his mother’s help, including housing and after-school pickups, with his two young daughters after their mother died in January 2014.
abstract: Marks JCH, beneficiary agency of UJA-Federation of New York, one of the seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, uses grant of $415 to cover school commuting costs for widower Yefim Ulitskiy's two daughters.
lead_paragraph: Yefim Ulitskiy, 55, has relied on his mother’s help, including housing and after-school pickups, with his two young daughters after their mother died in January 2014.

headline.main: After His Ex-Wife’s Death, a Struggle to Raise His Daughters
headline.print_headline: After Ex-Wife’s Death, a Struggle to Raise 2 Daughters

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations
